Class PixelConverter

java.lang.Object
se.kth.saeedvan.image_processor.utils.PixelConverter
public class PixelConverter extends Object
Static methods for conversions between an int representing ARGB-values and the separate parts alpha, red, green and blue.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    PixelConverter()
     

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static int
    getAlpha(int pixelValue)
    Return the alpha value, i.e. opacity value, 0..255, from an int representing ARGB.
    static int
    getBlue(int pixelValue)
    Return the blue value, 0..255, from an int representing ARGB.
    static int
    getGreen(int pixelValue)
    Return the green value, 0..255, from an int representing ARGB.
    static int
    getRed(int pixelValue)
    Return the red value, 0..255, from an int representing ARGB.
    static int
    toArgbPixel(int alpha, int red, int green, int blue)
    Create one single int representing an ARGB value.

      public static int getAlpha(int pixelValue)
      Return the alpha value, i.e. opacity value, 0..255, from an int representing ARGB.

    • getRed

      public static int getRed(int pixelValue)
      Return the red value, 0..255, from an int representing ARGB.

      Return the green value, 0..255, from an int representing ARGB.

    • getBlue

      Return the blue value, 0..255, from an int representing ARGB.

    • toArgbPixel

      public static int toArgbPixel(int alpha, int red, int green, int blue)
      Create one single int representing an ARGB value. The returned value can represent a pixel in a pixel matrix.
